jurisdiction.title: Council of Chief State School Officers

556125D9BCCF4295832B99CE6AC9BCC4.description:
use relative pronouns
(e.g., who, whom, which,
that), use relative adverbs (e.g.,
where, when, why), use prepositional phrases, use subordinating
conjunctions, use the progressive and
perfect verb tense, and produce and expand
simple, compound, and
complex sentences.

ACC512DEDC304789BE399ADA7EAA1330.description:
use relative pronouns
(e.g., who, whom, which,
that), use relative adverbs (e.g.,
where, when, why), use prepositional phrases, use subordinating
conjunctions, and produce and expand
simple, compound, and a
few complex sentences.

9DDA51FC602B4AC8B24536917ACE4E60.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences), use some relative
pronouns (e.g., who,
whom, which, that), use some relative
adverbs (e.g., where,
when, why), use some prepositional
phrases, and  produce and expand
simple and compound
sentences.

764BF945BBE04E5E84876458A9391A6D.description:
with support (including
visual aids and modeled
sentences), recognize and use some
frequently occurring
nouns, pronouns, verbs,
prepositions, adjectives,
adverbs, and conjunctions, and produce simple sentences
in response to prompts.

6CFEAFC3392146FCA63FC92614A8CAE5.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use a
small number of
frequently occurring
nouns, noun phrases,
and verbs, and understand and
respond to simple
questions.

2B4A173A27AF497095F0B9472AFA7886.description:
An ELL can make accurate
use of standard
English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate

speech and
writing.

B8D54ED4EF844092966EC82F83065460.description:
introduce an
informational topic, develop the topic with
facts and details, recount a more detailed
sequence of events, with
a beginning, middle, and
end, use a variety of linking
words and phrases to
connect ideas,
information, or events, and provide a concluding
statement or section.

210D299C57724F6197DD88C9EEDE42E3.description:
introduce an
informational topic
• develop the topic with
facts and details, recount a more detailed
sequence of events,
with a beginning,
middle, and end, use transitional words
and phrases to connect
events, ideas, and
opinions (e.g., after a
while, for example, in
order to, as a result), and provide a conclusion
with increasingly
independent control.

B224564C4263405785EAE0DDCA5233AE.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences), introduce an
informational topic, present one or two
facts about the topic, recount a short
sequence of events in
order, use an increasing range
of temporal and other
linking words (e.g.,
next, because, and,
also), and provide a concluding
statement
with developing control.

6431544E99B841CC9DE2BAD186AA1432.description:
with support (including
visual aids and modeled
sentences), communicate simple
information about a topic, recount a simple sequence
of events in order, and use frequently occurring
linking words (e.g., and,
then)
with emerging control.

3921457E55E04B3F9AE5970BB54A5956.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids),
and using non-verbal
communication, communicate simple
information about an
event or topic, and use a narrow range of
vocabulary and
syntactically simple
sentences
with limited control.

17316AA847874C7290873D7C9F00C22F.description:
An ELL can create clear and
coherent grade-appropriate

speech and text.

8106DAF6EA7448C9A597D970A0449E0A.description:
using context, reference
materials, and knowledge
of English morphology, determine the meaning of
general academic and
content-specific words
and phrases, and determine the meaning of
figurative language (e.g.,
metaphors, similes,
adages, and proverbs)
in texts about a variety of
topics, experiences, or
events.

962C70A2FEDC446F949DA8981D44F8A6.description:
using context, reference
materials, and an
increasing knowledge of
English morphology, determine the meaning
of general academic and
content-specific words,
phrases, and determine the meaning
of a growing number of
idiomatic expressions
in texts about a variety of
topics, experiences, or
events.

24E7061424654360A73E6C840DA70289.description:
using context, visual aids,
reference materials, and a
developing knowledge of
English morphology, determine the meaning
of frequently occurring
words and phrases, and determine the meanings
of some idiomatic
expressions
in texts about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

69C94F3B0E1E49279CA54F53B0A3F170.description:
using context, some visual
aids, reference materials,
and knowledge of
morphology in his or her
native language, and determine the meaning
of some frequently
occurring words, phrases,
and expressions
in simple oral discourse,
read-alouds, and written
texts about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

6F157327506D43A6A7E1846B68D59D78.description:
relying heavily on context,
visual aids, and knowledge
of morphology in his or her
native language, and recognize the meaning of
a few frequently
occurring words, phrases,
and formulaic
expressions
in simple oral discourse,
read-alouds, and written
texts about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

212DC45D8B744024B8166CC6F6F85CD4.description:
An ELL can determine the
meaning of
words and
phrases in oral
presentations
and literary and
informational
text.

B780369C20204727BC75FCD93B1C049D.description:
adapt language choices
and style according to
purpose, task, and
audience, and use a wide variety of
general academic and
content-specific words
and phrases
in speech and writing.

3D3EA3E8F45D49B5B0ECDEB6AF145579.description:
with increasing ease, adapt language choices
and style (includes
register) according to
purpose, task, and
audience, and use a wider range of
general academic and
content-specific words
and phrases
in speech and writing.

203BEF1E52694CBDBC73CA5BC58DEDE0.description:
with developing control, adapt language choices
according to purpose,
task, and audience, and use an increasing
number of general
academic and content-specific
words, phrases,
and expressions
in conversation,
discussions, and short
written text.

8C02520E78184EBDA88A34B4B56C98DA.description:
with emerging control, adapt language choices
to different social and
academic contents, and use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read
to.

DC94AC7033294BA0A4E9191FC145FF5E.description:
recognize the meaning of
some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read
to.

645F650F47B54E68AE7FC029E0BE328D.description:
An ELL can adapt language
choices to
purpose, task,
and audience
when speaking
and writing.

1D55B507AEB6470EA1FD41FAD5E30B52.description:
explain how an author or
speaker uses reasons and
evidence to support or
fail to support particular
points, and  (at grade 5) identify which
reasons and evidence
support which points.

62CA22CDBE674D8398DF054D5D3B579A.description:
describe how reasons
support the specific
points an author or
speaker makes or fails to
make

5DA5F0AF1F6E447ABFF7BF21B565D4DB.description:
tell how one or two
reasons support the
specific points an author
or speaker makes or
fails to make.

90AFEFA7D252429CAB7B6FFC5BE3D6FC.description:
identify a reason an
author or speaker gives
to support a main point and agree or disagree with
the author or speaker.

BE80F57AD0244B0CB061EE893440CD5B.description:
identify a point an author
or speaker makes.

C5E13F4334C94E2CAF45C474477694D0.description:
An ELL can analyze and
critique the
arguments of
others orally and
in writing.

2D21FA9B567643A2BDFBD30585ED6D5F.description:
recall information from
experience, gather information from
print and digital sources, summarize key ideas
and information in
detailed and orderly
notes, with graphics as
appropriate, and provide a list of sources.

F6A18AD4783E4435957AD14E5A3A7112.description:
recall information from
experience,  gather information from
print and digital sources
to answer a question, record information in
organized notes, with
charts, tables, or other
graphics, as appropriate, and provide a list of sources.

0ACFFCBC13C2414D95BE8C60976876D9.description:
recall information from
experience, gather information from
print and digital sources
to answer a question, and identify key information
in orderly notes.

E3BE3B0E880F494BB64AC8B729F394BC.description:
recall information from
experience, gather information from
provided sources, and record some information.

3DC0F8133AA54672BBD1F245675E8259.description:
recall information from
experience, gather information from
a few provided sources, and label some key
information.

BC878DC349A947A282CB4E91D0F74CF0.description:
An ELL can conduct
research and
evaluate and
communicate
findings to
answer
questions or
solve problems.

3EB8F1F954C04F84A28A9556B04E9416.description:
construct a claim about
a variety of topics, introduce the topic, provide logically ordered
reasons or facts to
support the claim, and provide a concluding
statement.

85847909477C4C4AA03383E9FB8CB13C.description:
construct a claim about a
variety of topics, introduce the topic, provide several reasons
or facts to support the
claim, and provide a concluding
statement.

57A42CBE3CC64DE3906BA71FA3734282.description:
construct a claim about
familiar topics, introduce the topic, and provide a few reasons or
facts to support the
claim.

264F9C9C92ED412387BDE47D6232AF79.description:
construct a simple claim
about a familiar topic and give a reason to support
the claim.

A24C0349C6004068B1DC5664C8FACEBD.description:
express an opinion about
a familiar topic.

3CC271BEF3D941D8BC82F21A8EA588FB.description:
An ELL can construct grade-appropriate
oral
and written
claims and
support them
with reasoning
and evidence.

954B76C45F264CEF9A57B4D0CFA32D27.description:
including details and
examples to develop a
topic, deliver oral
presentations, and compose written
narrative or
informational texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, and experiences.

98F22073EF704974A04ACADA95F5D25E.description:
including some details, deliver short oral
presentations, and compose written
narratives or
informational texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, and experiences.

98E45146E16E4096BC8BF8F2281A0460.description:
including a few details, deliver short oral
presentations, compose written
narratives or
informational texts
about familiar texts, topics,
and experiences.

396D8396E8FE4FA5844A5A022F7A4ACC.description:
deliver short oral
presentations and compose written texts
about familiar texts, topics,
and experiences.

3E49C6C2094C4DF18269EB24B65C5461.description:
communicate simple
information
about familiar texts, topics,
events, or objects in the
environment.

8EC8490C06584F6598EB9357FF5200EF.description:
An ELL can speak and write
about grade-appropriate

complex literary
and
informational
texts and topics.

63702BFABFDB4E6DBCD0F7C411D9414A.description:
participate in extended
conversations and
discussions, participate in extended
written exchanges, build on the ideas of
others, express his or her own
ideas clearly, pose and respond to
relevant questions,  add relevant and
detailed information
using evidence, and summarize the key
ideas expressed
about a variety of topics
and texts.

B66C6997B43D4EE9A7CCAB58CDCEBB1B.description:
participate in
conversations and
discussions, participate in written
exchanges, build on the ideas of
others, express his or her own
ideas, ask and answer relevant
questions, and add relevant information
and evidence about a variety of topics
and texts.

1171AECBB36E414AB357177F5DB24BFA.description:
participate in short
conversations and
discussions, participate in short
written exchanges, respond to others’
comments, add some comments of
his or her own, and ask and answer questions about familiar topics and
texts.

33662DFAB11B48D48025A3C9DF569870.description:
participate in short
conversations, participate in short
written exchanges, actively listen to others, and respond to simple
questions and whquestions about familiar topics and
texts.

06F942F844DD4FD29D8D5E0CF6C75F3E.description:
participate in short
conversations, participate in short
written exchanges, actively listen to others, and respond to simple
questions and some whquestions about familiar topics.

00C91A5025E248A88F0219E539FC2875.description:
An ELL can participate in
grade-appropriate
oral
and written
exchanges of
information,
ideas, and
analyses,
responding to
peer, audience,
or reader
comments and
questions.

383B65F0220140FE9AB8A2018D3D8F45.description:
use a wide range of
strategies to: determine two or more
main ideas or themes, explain how key details
support the main ideas
or themes, and summarize a text
from read-alouds, written
texts, and oral
presentations

6CA857FB49FB4ADFB27FF1720228FC86.description:
use an increasing range of
strategies to: determine the main idea
or theme, explain how some key
details support the main
idea or theme, and  summarize part of a text
from read-alouds, written
texts, and oral
presentations.

C5CC9C3051E040B5BB04BFD53D9FF343.description:
use a developing set of
strategies to: determine the main idea
or theme, and
• retell a few key details, and also retell familiar stories
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

901BF83A6A524D3A867DAF2DF3D5528B.description:
use an emerging set of
strategies to: identify the main topic and retell a few key details
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

250DDEA7653548FB97BD9E3B4DEBF416.description:
use a very limited set of
strategies to: identify a few key words
and phrases
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

6C597CE379AF46C3923B694F5EBD030B.description:
An ELL can construct
meaning from
oral
presentations
and literary and
informational text through
grade-appropriate

listening,
reading, and
viewing.
